newsitem.title: FRANCE: BASKETBALL-PAU BOUNCE BACK TO BEAT LJUBLJANA.
newsitem.headline: BASKETBALL-PAU BOUNCE BACK TO BEAT LJUBLJANA.

text.p: French side Pau-Orthez ended a sequence of seven consecutive defeats by beating Ljubljana of Slovenia in a EuroLeague basketball match on Wednesday.
French league leaders Pau-Orthez, who had not won a match in European competition since last November, bounced back to win 77-71 and keep alive a slim chance of qualifying for the next round.
Pau, who had lost the first leg 96-86 in Slovenia, restored some pride before their fans, taking command straightaway to lead 43-29 at halftime.
Ljubljana fought back in the second half and were trailing only 57-52 with eight minutes remaining. But the home side resisted to score a much-needed win.
"We had to be mentally strong to win that match," said Pau player Didier Gadou. "We were determined because we knew we had no other choice."
Pau can still clinch fourth place in group G and qualify for the next round if they manage to beat holders Panathinaikos next week.
